thread.title: Manziel admits drinking after being pulled over
thread.title_full: Manziel admits drinking after being pulled over

title: Manziel admits drinking after being pulled over
text:
Browns' Johnny Manziel admits to drinking after being pulled over Browns quarterback not charged with anything after being pulled over following argument with girlfriend. Post to Facebook Browns' Johnny Manziel admits to drinking after being pulled over Browns quarterback not charged with anything after being pulled over following argument with girlfriend. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/1LyDCX2 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. 27 To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Browns' Johnny Manziel admits to drinking after being pulled over Nate Davis , USA TODAY Sports 9:52 p.m. EDT October 16, 2015 Johnny Manziel has started one game in 2015. (Photo: Kirby Lee, USA TODAY Sports) 373 CONNECT 120 TWEET LINKEDIN 27 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Cleveland Browns quarterback Johnny Manziel was pulled over on Interstate 90 in Avon, Ohio, Monday after an argument with his girlfriend. He admitted to drinking earlier that day, according to a report obtained from the Avon Police department. 
According to the report, Colleen Elizabeth Crowley, Manziel's girlfriend, said he also pushed her head into the window of his white Nissan. However she did not want to press charges. A witness said Manziel was driving at a high speed and that Crowley was attempting to exit the vehicle before they stopped. 
"We were aware of the situation," Browns general manager Ray Farmer said in a statement. "It is a matter that we take seriously and have expressed our concerns to Johnny directly. Those conversations will remain private and we will refrain from further comment at this time."
